channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI

item.title: Report X-2023110109
item.description:
Report X-2023110109

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: CUDAHY
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: box left for QA with some evidence of being partly crushed or dropped, leaking DescribePack: Inside, 1 of 4 half-gallon plastic bottles of paint stripper gel had closure bent enough to allow approximately 0.2 gallons to spill, soaking all contents and inside of box DurationRel: 10 and MitigateEffect: box placed in plastic tote under ventilator hood

item.title: Report X-2023101164
item.description:
Report X-2023101164

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-10
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS FOUND IN THE UNLOAD LEAKING. APON ARRIVAL AT THE DMP A RESPONDER NOTICED THE CONTENTS WERE MORE DANGEROUS THAN THE PACKAGING SHOWED. AFTER MORE INVESTIGATION, IT WAS FOUND TO BE A HAZMAT ACCORDING TO THE PRODUCTS SDS.

item.title: Report E-2023110120
item.description:
Report E-2023110120

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-17T18:14:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-26
  • City: JANESVILLE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 26, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1263 was crushed in transit and released approximately five (5) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel overpacked the damaged pail in one (1) 55-gallon drum for future disposal.
